details.purpose: To record the degree of 'sickness' or 'physical state' prior to selecting the anaesthetic or prior to performing surgery.
details.use:
Used for recordkeeping, for communicating between colleagues, and to create a uniform system for statistical analysis.
This archetype has been designed to be used within a variety of ENTRY archetypes - for example an EVALUATION for a pre-operative anaesthetic assessment or an infection control investigation.
details.misuse: Not intended for use as a measure to predict operative risk.

description.other_details: American Society for Anesthesiologists: http://www.asahq.org/clinical/physicalstatus.htm Cleveland Clinic (provided examples of each state): http://my.clevelandclinic.org/services/Anesthesia/hic_ASA_Physical_Classification_System.aspx

items.description: Classification system adopted by the American Society of Anesthesiologists for assessing preoperative physical status.
Assessed pre-operative status of a patient.
No organic, physiologic, or psychiatric disturbance; excludes the very young and very old; healthy with good exercise tolerance.

items.text: 2 - A patient with mild systemic disease
items.description: No functional limitations; has a well-controlled disease of one body system; controlled hypertension or diabetes without systemic effects, cigarette smoking without chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD); mild obesity, pregnancy.

items.text: 3 - A patient with severe systemic disease
items.description: Some functional limitation; has a controlled disease of more than one body system or one major system; no immediate danger of death; controlled congestive heart failure (CHF), stable angina, old heart attack, poorly controlled hypertension, morbid obesity, chronic renal failure; bronchospastic disease with intermittent symptoms.

items.text: 4 - A patient with severe systemic disease that is a constant threat to life
items.description: Has at least one severe disease that is poorly controlled or at end stage; possible risk of death; unstable angina, symptomatic COPD, symptomatic CHF, hepatorenal failure.

items.text: 5 - A moribund patient who is not expected to survive without the operation
items.description: Not expected to survive > 24 hours without surgery; imminent risk of death; multiorgan failure, sepsis syndrome with hemodynamic instability, hypothermia, poorly controlled coagulopathy.

items.text: 6 - A declared brain-dead patient whose organs are being removed for donor purposes
